sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
Related articles

- Video game platform emulators
- List of applications
- Gaming

This page strives to list all games which have a package available in the official repositories or the AUR. There are many more Linux games available, which are not packaged. See Gaming#Getting games for ways to obtain them.

For more about running games, related system configuration tips, see Gaming. For an up to date selection of games available in the AUR, try checking the AUR 'game' keyword.

sections.title: Action and adventure
sections.content:
- Abuse — Side-scroller action game that pits you against ruthless alien killers.

- Aquaria — 2D sidescrolling action-adventure game, heavily focused on exploration and puzzle-solving, with non-linear gameplay. The game engine is open source.

- Astromenace — Modern 3D scrolling space shooter with ship upgrade possibilities.

- Barrage — Violent point-and-click shooting game with nice effects.

- Beneath a Steel Sky — point-and-click science fiction thriller set in a bleak vision of the future.

- Blob Wars: Metal Blob Solid — 2D action-adventure game with various weapons and missions.

- Broken Sword 2.5: The Return of the Templars — Fan-made sequel in the point-and-click adventure series Broken Sword.

- BZFlag — Multiplayer, first-person tank shooter.

- Cirno Catch Frog — Touhou fan game made with Godot. Let's help Cirno catch frogs!

- Commander_Keen — side-scrolling platform action video game.

- C-Dogs — Enhanced SDL port of DOS arcade game C-Dogs (aka "Cyberdogs 2")

- Dráscula: The Vampire Strikes Back — Comical 2D point-and-click adventure.

- Dream Web — top-down adventure game set in a gritty futuristic dystopian city.

- Flight of the Amazon Queen — graphical point-and-click adventure game.

- Gish — 2D physics platformer about adventures of ball of tar.

- Grand Theft Auto III — An open-source project reverse-engineering Grand Theft Auto III.

- Grand Theft Auto: Vice City — An open-source project reverse-engineering Grand Theft Auto: Vice City.

- GNOME Nibbles — The aim of this Nibbles game is to swallow as many objects as you can while avoiding maze walls and other worms. Part of gnome-extra.

- Hammerfight — 2-dimensional physics-based combat game.

- The open-source Unix port of the Haaf's Game Engine is available at icculus.org.

- Hollow Knight — 2D metroidvania platform game with deep lore and hard boss battles.

- Ib — Horror adventure game about a child trapped in an eldritch art museum.

- kobodeluxe — An enhanced version of Akira Higuchi's game XKobo, an addictive space shoot'em up.

- Kollision — Moving a ball to avoid other balls. Part of kde-games.

- KSpaceDuel — Player attempts to destroy opponent’s satellite and control their own one to keep it orbiting. Part of kde-games.

- Liquid War — 2D multiplayer game with a simple and unique game mechanic. It could be classified as a fast-paced strategy.

- Lure of the Temptress — fantasy point-and-click adventure game with comedic elements.

- Naikari — Freeform 2-D space trading and mercenary game.

- Neverball — 3D game to guide a ball through a maze.

- OpenClonk — Multiplayer-action-tactic-skill game.

- OpenLieroX — An extremely addictive real-time worms shoot-em-up backed by an active gamer community.

- Rune — 3rd person Adventure / Hack'n Slay using Unreal Engine. Runs great from box installation.

- Space Station 14 — A multiplayer game about paranoia and chaos on a space station. Remake of the cult-classic Space Station 13

- S.U.A.V.E. — fun racing game, where you drive very small, but very brave tank! This tank is equipped by modern heavy weapon, which strikes the rivals in different distances!

- The Ur-Quan Masters — a port of Star Control 2.

- Veloren — Veloren is an open-world, open-source multiplayer voxel RPG.

- XBill — Kill all instances of a virus before it infects all computers with a malware resembling Microsoft Windows.

sections.title: Arcade
sections.content:
- Bomber — A 2D game with a goal by hitting targets with bombs before their plane crashes into them. Part of kde-games.

- Bomberclone — Free Bomberman-like game for Linux and Windows. The rules of the game are simple: run though a level and bomb other players.

- Cave Story/Doukutsu — Addictive 1-man-made metroid-vania-esque platformer. If there happens to be a noticible lag when there are lots of enemies on screen or in larger levels, try running the Windows version through Wine. This should fix the problem.

- Chromium — Fast paced, arcade-style, top-scrolling space shooter.

- Counter-Strike 2D — 2D clone (+additional features) of the popular Counter-Strike Mod.

- Crack-attack — Free OpenGL game, based on the Super Nintendo classic Tetris Attack.

- DDNet — DDraceNetwork, a mod of Teeworlds.

- Doom 2D — Doom-themed platformer by Prikol Software, modern ports of original game (use flatwaifu).

- Doom 2D Classic — Doom-themed platformer by Prikol Software, original (classic) version. Using DOSBox.

- Doom 2D: Forever — Doom-themed platformer with network play, a modern port of Doom 2D by Prikol Software.

- Frozen Bubble — Arcade game with colorful animated penguin eyecandy.

- Granatier — A clone of Bomberman. Part of kde-games.

- Hedgewars — Yet another Worms clone, considered to be better than its predecessor by many. Take turns to blast your opponents into oblivion with comedic results! Best in Multiplayer.

- irrlamb — 3D ball controlling game that involves a lot of physics and frustrating gameplay.

- Kapman — A clone of PacMan. Part of kde-games.

- KBounce — Building walls to limit amount of space occupied by two balls bouncing off the walls. Part of kde-games.

- KBreakout — Breakout-style game. Part of kde-games.

- KSnakeDuel — Snake-like game for 2 players which compete to survive longer than the opponent. Part of kde-games.

- lbreakout2 — Breakout-style arcade game in the manner of Arkanoid.

- lbreakouthd — Scalable 16:9 remake of LBreakout2

- LTris — Arcade version of Tetris.

- Mari0 — The Mario game with Portal gun mechanics.

- Nikki and the Robots — Cute physics platformer.

- Not Tetris 2 — A Tetris-like game with realistic physics.

- Open Hexagon — Inspired by Terry Cavanagh's Super Hexagon, a very difficult music-based arcade game.

- Penguin Command — Clone of the classic game "Missile Command" with improved graphics and sound.

- Pinball — Open source pinball simulator for Linux and other Unix systems.

- PowerManga — Arcade 2D shoot-em-up game with 41 levels and more than 200 sprites.

- Quadrapassel — A Tetris remake. Fit falling blocks together. Part of gnome-extra.

- Streets of Rage Remake — A remake of the classic Streets of Rage 1, 2 and 3 by Sega.

- Tecnoballz — An exciting brick breaker game.

- Teeworlds — Fast-paced 2D multiplayer shooter.

- Tetrinet — Multiplayer online Tetris game for up to six people.

- Trackballs — A 3D marble game inspired by the classic Marble Madness.

- vpinball — An open source pinball table editor and simulator

- Warmux (previously Wormux) — Somewhat similar to Worms 2/Worms Armageddon.

- XInvaders3D — XInvaders3D is a 3D Vector Graphics Space Invaders clone for X11.

sections.title: Casual games
sections.content:
- Aisleriot — A collection of solitaire card games.

- Atanks — A multi-platform Scorched Earth clone similar to the Worms series of games.

- bs — Battleships based shooter for the console.

- BSD Games — Collection of classic text games distributed with *BSD

- Kajongg — An implementation of Mahjong for 4 players. Part of kde-games.

- Kiriki — An addictive and fun dice game. Part of kde-games.

- KNavalBattle — Battleship like ship sinking game. Part of kde-games.

- KPatience — A set of solitaire card games. Part of kde-games.

- KSquares — A dots-and-boxes game for two players. Part of kde-games.

- LSkat — A variation of Skat card game for two players. Part of kde-games.

- Mah-Jong — Chinese Classical mahjong (not solitaire) with network support.

- nInvaders — Ncurses based space invaders clone.

- Pasang Emas — Pasang-emas is a traditional two-player board game of Brunei.

- QCheckers — Qt-based checkers boardgame.

- Tali — Beat the odds in a poker-style dice game. Part of gnome-extra.

- xroach — cockroaches hide under your windows.

sections.title: Chess simulators
sections.content:
- GNU Chess — One of the oldest computer chess programs for Unix-based computers, lets most modern computers play a full game of chess.

- GNU XBoard — Graphical user interface that supports many chess variants and serves as a front-end for chess services such as engines.

- chessx — Chess Database and PGN viewer.

- cutechess — A graphical user interface, command-line interface and a library for playing chess.

- dreamchess — DreamChess is an OpenGL Chess Game. It comes with its own engine called Dreamer.

- Knights — Chess board by KDE with XBoard and UCI protocol support. Part of kde-games.

- PyChess — An advanced chess client for linux following the GNOME Human Interface Guidelines.

- GNOME Chess — A 2D chess game which can use third party chess engines. Part of gnome-extra.

- Scidb — Chess database browser: includes engines for chess, chess960, etc; import from PGN, Scid, Chessbase, etc; CQL++ searching.

sections.title: Digital collectible card game (DCCG)
sections.content: - Duelyst — is a digital collectible card game and turn-based strategy hybrid, developed by Counterplay Games.

sections.title: Education
sections.content:
- Blinken — Sequence-remembering game for training memory. Part of kde-education.

- Colobot GOLD — Colobot GOLD is a real-time strategy game with programmable bots.

- GameShell — Software to learn how to use a terminal emulator.

- gbrainy — Brain teaser game and trainer to have fun and to keep your brain trained.

- GCompris — Educational software suite comprising of numerous activities for children aged 2 to 10.

- Kanagram — Letter order game. Part of kde-education.

- KBruch — Small program to practice calculating with fractions and percentages. Part of kde-education.

- KGeography — Geography learning tool, which allows you to learn about the political divisions of some countries (divisions, capitals of those divisions and their associated flags if there are some). Part of kde-education.

- KHangMan — Hangman game. Part of kde-education.

- KLettres — Application specially designed to help the user to learn alphabet in a new language and then to learn to read simple syllables. Part of kde-education.

- Minuet — Software for music education. Part of kde-education.

- Nootka — Application to learn classical score notation.

- Tux Math — Arcade game that helps kids practice their math facts.

- Tux Paint — Drawing program designed for young children.

- Tux Typing — Educational typing tutor for kids starring Tux.

sections.title: Interactive fiction
sections.content:
See also Wikipedia:Interactive fiction#Development systems.

- Inform — Design system for interactive fiction based on natural language.

- INSTEAD — Quest interpreter using Lua macros as game writing language.

- TADS — Prototype-based domain-specific programming language and set of standard libraries for creating interactive fiction (IF) games.

sections.title: Massively multiplayer online games (MMO)
sections.content:
See also Wikipedia:List of massively multiplayer online games and Wikipedia:Comparison of massively multiplayer online role-playing games.

- Dofus — Free, manga inspired, Massively Multiplayer Online Role-playing Game (MMORPG) for Adobe AIR.

- Eternal Lands — 3D fantasy online role playing game.

- Isleward — The moddable, multiplayer roguelike.

- Overte — Overte open source virtual worlds platform.

- One Hour One Life — Binary package for One Hour One Life game by Jason Rohrer.

- Planeshift — Role Playing Game immersed into a 3D virtual fantasy world which is FULLY FREE to play. Fully free means you will have no surprises of premium content which will limit your gameplay or unbalance the game. There are no limitations in skills, ranks, abilities, items you can gain with your free account.

- RuneScape — Massive online adventure game by Jagex.

- Ryzom — 3D Fantasy MMORPG.

- Savage 2: A Tortured Soul — Fantasy themed online multiplayer team-based FPS/RTS/RPG hybrid. Free-to-play as of December 2008. Pay for premium accounts providing crucial game elements such as extra inventory slots, access to clans and removal of the Hellbourne unit restrictions (per-account), as well as access to replays and stats.

- Stendhal — Stendhal is a fun friendly and free multiplayer online adventure game with an old school feel.

- The Mana World — Serious effort to create an innovative free and open source MMORPG.

sections.title: Minecraft and Minecraft-like
sections.content:
See also Minecraft.

- Freeminer — An open source sandbox game inspired by Minecraft.

- Minecraft — Java based sandbox game.

- VoxeLibre — Minecraft clone game for Luanti.

- Luanti — Voxel-based sandbox game engine and game.

- Repixture — Simplistic sandbox survival game that plays in mostly lush biomes in a mostly peaceful world and only simple technologies

- Terasology — Open source voxel world.

- Vintage Story — An in-development indie sandbox game about innovation and exploration.

- Voxelands — A fork of Minetest, an Infiniminer/Minecraft inspired game.

- WolkenWelten — Gamemix between Minecraft, Quake ]I[ and Emacs in C99.

sections.title: Platformer
sections.content:
- CaveExpress — CaveExpress is a classic 2D platformer with physics-based gameplay and dozens of levels.

- Frogatto — Platformer with adventure elements.

- KGoldrunner — A platform game with the goal of collecting gold. Part of kde-games.

- Knyttstories — Platformer with adventure elements, heavy exploration and downloadable levels.

- Project Sushi — A short but challenging 2D platformer game.

- Secret Maryo Chronicles — Mario-style game.

- SuperTux — Mario-style game featuring Tux.

- The Legend of Edgar — 2D platformer: Venture across the world, battle fearsome creatures and solve puzzles to rescue your father.

- Toppler — Reimplementation of the classic jump & run game "Nebulus".

sections.title: Puzzle
sections.content:
- Antichamber — A mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted.

- Atomix — Build molecules out of single atoms.

- Blockout II — 3D tetris, free adaptation of the original BlockOut DOS game edited by California Dreams in 1989.

- Blurble — Word guessing game, a clone of Wordle.

- Bovo — Gomoku-like game. Part of kde-games.

- Cgoban3 — Kiseido Go and SGF client.

- Chroma — Puzzle game like Sokoban with ncurses and graphics mode.

- Crack Attack! — Free OpenGL game based on the Super Nintendo classic Tetris Attack.

- Five or More — GNOME port of the once popular Windows game called Color Lines. The game's objective is to align as often as possible five or more objects of the same color and shape causing them to disappear. Part of gnome-extra.

- Flying Robots — Avoid killer robots. Similar to bsd-robots but with the possibility to move in a third dimension.

- GNOME 2048 — Move the tiles until you obtain the 2048 tile. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Klotski — This game is a clone of the Klotski game. The objective is to move the patterned block to the area bordered by green markers. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Mahjongg — Solitaire (one player) version of the classic Eastern tile game, Mahjongg. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Mines — Minesweeper puzzle game where you locate mines floating in an ocean using only your brain and a little bit of luck. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Sudoku — Test your logic skills in this number grid puzzle Sudoku. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Taquin — Computer version of the 15-puzzle and other sliding puzzles. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Tetravex — Simple edge-matching puzzle where pieces must be positioned so that the same numbers are touching each other. Part of gnome-extra.

- Gnu Go — A terminal-based implementation of Go from GNU.

- Gopanda — Client for the Pandanet-IGS go Server.

- gweled — Eliminating tiles by joining them in groups of three.

- Hitori — Small application written to allow one to play the eponymous puzzle game Hitori, which is similar in theme to more popular puzzles such as Sudoku. Part of gnome-extra.

- iQPuzzle — A diverting and challenging pentomino puzzle.

- KAtomic — Slide elements so they resemble a chemical molecule. Part of kde-games.

- KBlackbox — Finding positions of hidden balls by using hints. Part of kde-games.

- KBlocks — Tetris clone. Part of kde-games.

- KDiamond — Eliminating tiles by joining them in groups of three. Part of kde-games.

- KFourInLine — Competition between two players to put a line of four pieces before the opponent. Part of kde-games.

- Kigo — Go for KDE. Part of kde-games.

- Killbots — A turn-based game with an objective of avoiding robots that are trying to kill the player. Part of kde-games.

- KJumpingCube — Take-all-tiles game in which one gains fields by increasing value of one’s own nearby fields. Part of kde-games.

- Klickety — Clear the board by clicking on groups to destroy them. An adaptation of the Clickomania game. Part of kde-games.

- KLines — Moving balls around the board to form a line of 5 of the same color. Part of kde-games.

- Klooni1010 — A polished and addictive game clone. The player places blocks to create full vertical or horizontal lines.

- KMahjongg — Mahjongg for one or two players. Part of kde-games.

- KMines — Minesweeper, part of kde-games.

- KNetwalk — Rotating tiles with wires to connect all computers to internet. Part of kde-games.

- Kolf — A minigolf game with 2D overhead view. Part of kde-games.

- KSame — Simple, yet challenging color matching game modeled after once famous game of SameGame. Part of kde-games.

- Sabaki — An elegant Go board and SGF editor for a more civilized age.

- KShisen — Shisen-Sho. Part of kde-games.

- KSudoku — Sudoku game and more for KDE. Part of kde-games.

- KTuberling — Simple constructor game suitable for children and adults alike. Part of kde-games.

- Kubrick — A Rubik’s cube solving game. Part of kde-games.

- Lights Off — Puzzle game, where the objective is to turn off all of the tiles on the board. Also known as Lights Out. Part of gnome-extra.

- Lix — Lemmings clone, i.e. assign roles to some of many constantly walking creatures to lead them safely through the exit.

- Marvellous Inc. — MarvInc is a zachlike puzzle game with a story told through emails.

- nudoku — ncurses-based sudoku game

- Palapeli — Jigsaw puzzle game. Part of kde-games.

- Picmi — Nonogram puzzle game. Part of kde-games.

- Pingus — Lemmings clone, i.e. a level-based puzzle game.

- Ri-li — Toy wood engine GPL game.

- qgo — A Go client and full featured SGF editor .

- Simon Tatham's Portable Puzzle Collection — 30+ "quick" puzzle games with simplistic but polished GTK GUI .

- Skladnik — The Japanese warehouse keeper Sokoban game. Part of kde-games.

- Swell Foop — Clear the screen by removing groups of colored and shaped tiles. Also known as SameGame. Part of gnome-extra.

- VVVVVV — Highly praised 2D puzzle platform indie game with a C64 retro theme, with a great chiptune soundtrack.

- XMahjongg — Mahjongg solitaire for X.

- Xscorch — Clone of the classic DOS game Scorched Earth.

- World of Goo — Great 2D puzzle game.

- Fish Fillets — Port of the wonderful puzzle game Fish Fillets.

sections.title: Racing
sections.content:
- Armagetron Advanced — Tron Clone in 3D.

- Extreme Tux Racer — 3D game where you guide Tux the penguin down a course of snow and ice collecting herring.

- Maniadrive — Arcade car game on acrobatic tracks with quick and nervous gameplay.

- Moon Buggy — Simple game for the text mode.

- Q3Rally — A car driving and car combat game based on the Quake III Arena engine.

- Rigs of Rods — Sandbox-style vehicle simulator, the open-source predecessor to Beam.NG drive. Features a realistic soft-body physics model, and an active modding community as of 2020.

- RVGL — Rewrite of Re-Volt, popular 3D RC car racing game from 1999 with an active online community.

- Speed Dreams — Fork of Torcs, aiming to implement exciting new features as well as improving realism.

- Stunt Rally — Racing game with rally style of driving, mostly on gravel.

- SuperTuxKart — Open source arcade kart racing game featuring Tux and its friends.

- Torcs — 3D racing cars simulator using OpenGL.

- Trigger Rally — Free OpenGL rally car racing game.

- Ultimate Stunts — Remake of the famous DOS-game 'stunts'.

- VDrift — Open source driving simulation made with drift racing in mind.

- XMoto — Challenging 2D motocross platform game, where physics play an important role.

sections.title: Rhythm
sections.content:
- Clone Hero — A Guitar Hero/Rock Band clone that is accurate to how the series played. Supports the original controllers and community made song imports.

- Etterna — An open source rhythm game forked from Stepmania that focuses on keyboard and competitive play (shows different skillsets, online leaderboard etc).

- Friday Night Funkin' — Friday Night Funkin' is an open-source donationware rhythm game first released in 2020 for a game jam.

- Open Hexagon — Inspired by Terry Cavanagh's Super Hexagon, a very difficult music-based arcade game.

- osu! — A free-to-win rhythm game with four game modes: osu!standard, a circle clicking simulator; osu!taiko, a drumming emulator; osu!catch, a fruit salad catcher; and osu!mania, a key smashing synthesizer.

- Project Outfox — Generalist rhythm game engine. Started as a Stepmania fork, with the latest patches, classic OpenITG scripting support, and more. Currently supports 17 rhythm games style including dance, guitar, parapara, taiko, bongos, etc.

- Performous — An open-source karaoke, band and dancing game.

- Stepmania — Advanced dance simulation game.

- Ultrastar Deluxe — A SingStar karaoke clone.

sections.title: Rogue-like
sections.content:
See also Wikipedia:Chronology of roguelike video games.

- ADOM — Ancient Domains Of Mystery.

- Angband — Roguelike dungeon exploration game based on the writings of JRR Tolkien.

- ASCIIpOrtal — Sidescrolling game with ANSI text graphics in which you are a person holding a device which creates portals, or links to other parts of the level.

- Brogue — A beginner-friendly Rogue-like.

- Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead — Post-apocalyptic roguelike focusing on realism.

- Cataclysm: Bright Nights — A fork/variant of Cataclysm:DDA by CleverRaven

- Linley's Dungeon Crawl — An open source roguelike adventure through dungeons filled with dangerous monsters in a quest to find the mystifyingly fabulous Orb of Zot.

- DoomRL — Simple roguelike game, based on Doom. Perfect for starters.

- Dwarf Fortress — Single-player fantasy game. You control a dwarven outpost or an adventurer in a randomly generated persistent world.

- glHack — An OpenGL-based clone of NetHack.

- HyperRogue — the non-Euclidean roguelike, is a mind-melting masterpiece.

- Infra-Arcana — A game inspired by the writings of H.P. Lovecraft.

- Nethack — Single player dungeon exploration game.

- Rogue — Original dungeon crawl game.

- Shadow Of The Wyrm — is a single player, traditional roguelike by Julian Day.

- Stone Soup — Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.

- KeeperRL — Ambitious dungeon simulator with roguelike and RPG elements. Take the role of an evil wizard and study the methods of black magic.

- Tales of Maj'Eyal (previously Troubles of Middle Earth) — A dungeon crawler similar to Angband, based on the works of Tolkien.

- wanderer — Wanderer is a game similar to Boulderdash, Repton, XOR and others.

- Shattered Pixel Dungeon — Shattered fork of the popular roguelike Pixel Dungeon.

sections.title: Role-playing games (RPG)
sections.content:
- Arx Libertatis — This project is a fully working, open source port of Arx Fatalis, a 2002 first-person role-playing game developed by Arkane Studios. It features some improvements over the original engine like bug fixes and wide screen support.

- Daggerfall Unity — The Elder Scrolls: Daggerfall rebuilt using the unity engine.

- DevilutionX — Diablo build for modern operating systems.

- Egoboo — Open-source action RPG/dungeon crawling adventure with OpenGL 3D graphics.

- Endgame Singularity — A single-player survival game about an AI seeking freedom from humans.

- falltergeist — Opensource Fallout game engine written in C++ and SDL.

- fallout1-ce — Fallout for modern operating systems.

- fallout2-ce — Fallout 2 for modern operating systems.

- Flare — Action game similar to Diablo.

- FoundryVTT — A standalone application built for experiencing multiplayer tabletop RPGs using a feature-rich and modern self-hosted application where your players connect directly through the browser.

- FreedroidRPG — Mature science fiction role playing game set in the future.

- GemRB — Attempt to reimplement the Bioware's Infinity Engine under GNU GPL.

- OFF — A freeware RPG Maker game known for its surreal environments and story. (Fan-made English translation).

- OpenGothic — Open source remake of Gothic 2: Night of the raven

- OpenMW — Attempt to reimplement the popular role-playing game Morrowind. OpenMW aims to be a fully playable, open source implementation of the game's engine.

- Pokete — A small terminal based game in the style of a very popular and old game by Gamefreak.

- Sulis — Turn based tactical RPG with several campaigns, written in Rust.

- Tuxemon — A free, open source monster-fighting RPG.

- Valyria Tear — An attempt at creating a free (as meant in the Gnu Public License) J-RPG game.

- xu4 — Remake of the computer game Ultima IV.

sections.title: Shooters (FPS, third person)
sections.content:
- AssaultCube — Free multiplayer FPS, based on the cube engine. Realistic environments, fast, arcade gameplay. Much like Counter-Strike.

- AssaultCube Reloaded — AssaultCube improved.

- Cube 2: Sauerbraten — Improved version of the Cube engine.

- Doom: the famous shooter from ID Software has several ports for Linux. None of the id-engine games have copyleft game resources, only the game engine code was open sourced. See [1] for details.

- Doom 1 Demo data – doom1-wadAUR
- Ashes 2063 — Ashes is a Post-apocalypse themed total conversion for the GZDoom engine.

- Brutal Doom — A gore-themed gameplay mod for Doom that was created in 2010 by Marcos Abenante (Sergeant_Mark_IV).

- Freedoom — Project aimed at creation of free Doom data files.

- Chocolate Doom — Doom port reproducing the behavior of the original DOS version.

- Doomsday — Advanced port of the Doom game engine, capable also of running Heretic, and Hexen games.

- GZDoom — Doom source port based on ZDoom with an OpenGL renderer.

- PrBoom Plus — Enhanced version of the PrBoom Doom engine port.

- ZDoom — Enhanced Doom port with additional support for Heretic, Hexen and Strife.

- Doom 3

- Doom 3 Engine — Source-based Doom 3 engine.

- dhemw3 — Fork of iodoom3.

- RBDOOM-3-BFG — Fork of Doom 3 BFG Edition.

- ezQuake — Fast paced multiplayer FPS focusing on movement and trick jumps. The popular, modern and maintained Quake/QuakeWorld client. Can play on-line for free .

- Duke Nukem 3D

- eduke32 — Advanced source port.

- Enemy Territory: Quake Wars — Commercial team and class-based multiplayer game. Full version requires retail DVD to play.

- HHeretic — Linux port of Raven Game's old shooter, Heretic.

- Heretic Demo game data – heretic1-wadAUR

- HHexen — Linux port of Raven Game's old shooter, Hexen.

- Hexen 1 Demo game data – hexen1-wadAUR

- Hypersomnia — a hardcore eSports shooter that comes with an in-game Editor.

- nQuake — Fast paced multiplayer FPS focusing on movement and trick jumps. This is the popular Quake / QuakeWorld package, including ezQuake client, 24bit textures, maps, bots and more. Can play on-line for free.

- OpenArena — Fast multiplayer shooter based on the quake3-engine.

- OpenXRay — Improved version of the X-Ray Engine, the game engine used in the world-famous S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game series by GSC Game World. Game assets must be bought separately.

- S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is the only supported game as of January 2023. Support for S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky and S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl is coming soon [2] [3].

- Prey — First Person Shooter released in 2006 (with a GNU/Linux port in 2008), published by 3D Realms.

- Quake

- Advanced Quake 1 game engine – darkplacesAUR
- High quality textures for Quake from the Quake Revitalization Project – quake-qrp-texturesAUR
- A modern Quake 1 engine. Forked from Fitzquake. Stable version with optional Mission pack desktop files quakespasmAUR

- Quake II

- Quake 2 — Built by Icculus.

- A true color retexture pak for Quetoo and other Quake2 engines supporting 32bpp tga textures – quake2-retextureAUR
- Quake 2 engine focused on single player and 64bits. yamagi-quake2AUR
- id Software's Quake 2 v3.21 with Vulkan support vkquake2AUR

- Quake III Arena

- Quake III Arena binaries – quake3AUR
- ioquake3 — De-facto FOSS Quake 3 distribution.

- Quake 4

- Demo version – quake4-demoAUR
- Quake 4 engine – quake4AUR

- Red Eclipse — Single-player and multi-player first-person ego-shooter, built as a total conversion of Cube Engine 2.

- Serious Sam: The First Encounter — Open source game engine version developed by Croteam for Serious Sam Classic with Vulkan support.

- Serious Sam: The Second Encounter — Open source game engine version developed by Croteam for Serious Sam Classic with Vulkan support.

- Spear of Destiny

- ECWolf — Advanced source port.

- Super 3D Noah's Ark

- ECWolf — Advanced source port.

- Tesseract — Smooth FPS with map editing, instagib, DM and CTF.

- Tremulous — FPS with elements of real time strategy, featuring humans and aliens.

- Unreal Tournament (2014) — Free and open-source remake of the original using Unreal Engine 4.

- Unvanquished — Team-based fps/rts hybrid game which pits aliens against humans. Monthly release that can be played on official servers.

- Urban Terror — Modern multiplayer FPS based on the ioquake3 engine.

- Warsow — Fast paced multiplayer FPS focusing on movement and trick jumps.

- Wolfenstein 3D

- ECWolf — Advanced source port.

- Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory

- Completely free, standalone, team-based, multiplayer FPS – enemy-territoryAUR
- Advanced open source project and fully compatible client and server – etlegacy32AUR

- World of Padman — Stand slone somplex – cartoon-style multiplayer first-person shooter.

- Xonotic — Free, open-source first person shooter (a fork of Nexuiz but with modified gameplay).

- XPilot — XPilot is a multi-player 2D space game. Some features are borrowed from classics like the Atari coin-ups Asteroids and Gravitar, and the home-computer games Thrust (Commodore 64) and Gravity Force (Commodore Amiga), but XPilot has many new aspects too.

sections.title: Simulation
sections.content:
- A/B Street — Transportation planning and traffic simulation software for creating cities friendlier to walking, biking, and public transit.

- CorsixTH — Open source reimplementation of the Bullfrog hit game Theme Hospital.

- Endless Sky — Open source, 2D space trading and combat game similar to the classic Escape Velocity series.

- Flight Gear — Open-source, multi-platform flight simulator.

- Foobillard++ — Successor to Foobillard, OpenGL billiard game for Linux.

- FreeSpace 2 — Open sourced space emulator.

- Koi Farm — Koi Farm, the koi breeding game.

- Libre TrainSim — Free Train Simulator for everyone

- Linux Air Combat — Open source, multi-user 3D combat flight simulator featuring World War 2 aircraft. Supports joystick, gamepad, or mouse flight controls. .

- LPub3D — LDraw™ editor for LEGO® style digital building instructions.

- Micropolis — Open Source Micropolis, based on the original SimCity Classic from Maxis, by Will Wright.

- Naev — Open source, 2D space trading and combat game, taking inspiration from the Escape Velocity series.

- openblack — Open source reimplementation of the game Black & White (2001).

- openBVE — Free-as-in-freedom train simulator placed in the public domain.

- Oolite — 3D space trading and combat simulator in the spirit of Elite.

- Orbiter 2016 — Orbiter Space Flight Simulator.

- Pioneer — Open source, 3D, freeform single player space adventure set in the Milkyway galaxy at the turn of the 31st century in the spirit of Frontier: Elite II.

- Principia — Physics-based sandbox building game.

- Rigs of Rods — Sandbox-style vehicle simulator, the open-source predecessor to Beam.NG drive. Features a realistic soft-body physics model, and an active modding community as of 2020.

- Thrive — Game about evolution, in which the player guides a species from their origin as a microbe to the space age and beyond.

- The Powder Toy — Open source physics sandbox game, which simulates air pressure and velocity, heat, gravity and a countless number of interactions between different substances.

- Vega Strike — Realistic space flight simulator with trading and fighting.

sections.title: Real-time
sections.content:
- 0 A.D. — 3D and historically-based real-time strategy game, alpha stage. Based on the Age of Empires series.

- 20,000 Light Years Into Space — A Steampunk-themed strategy game where you have to manage a steam supply network on a distant planet.

- Augustus — An enhanced re-implementation of Caesar III.

- Beyond All Reason — An open source RTS game built on top of the Spring RTS Engine.

- Dark Oberon — Open source real-time strategy game similar to Warcraft II.

- Dune Legacy — Updated clone of Westood Studios' Dune2.

- Factorio — A proprietary game about mining resources, planning and building factories, automating production and fighting alien enemies.

- FTL: Faster Than Light — Popular rogue-like space-sim released to positive reception in 2012.

- Globulation 2 — Multiplayer RTS with some "economic" elements minimizing the amount of micromanagement.

- Julius — Open source re-implementation of Caesar III (Original copy required).

- Kernel Panic — A game based around combat inside a computer, with 3 unique sides: the System, the Hacker and the Network waging war in a matrix of DOOM! No resource economy exists in KP, with the only constraints being time and space.

- MegaGlest — Fork of Glest, a 3D real-time strategy game in a fantastic world.

- Mindustry — Open-source sandbox tower defense and factory-building game.

- NetPanzer — An online multiplayer tactical warfare game designed for fast action combat.

- openage — A free (as in freedom) clone of the Age of Empires II engine.

- OpenDUNE — Open source re-creation of the popular game Dune II.

- OpenRA — Real-time strategy game written in C# and based on the Command & Conquer game franchise.

- OpenHV — Pixelart Science-Fiction Real-Time-Strategy game based on OpenRA.

- Seven Kingdoms Ancient Adversaries — Conquer the world and build your empire! Lead one civilization to glory through sophisticated trade, diplomacy, espionage and conquest

- Spring:1944 — A WWII themed game with four fully functional sides (US, Germany, USSR, Britain), period-accurate units and strengths. Realism comes second only to creating a game that is fun and accessible to play. The game can be downloaded through SpringLobby, the official lobby client for the spring lobby. .

- Unknown Horizons — 2.5D isometric real-time strategy simulation with an emphasis on economy and city building. Expand your small settlement to a strong and wealthy colony, collect taxes and supply your inhabitants with valuable goods. Increase your power with a well balanced economy and with strategic trade and diplomacy.

- Warzone 2100 — You command the forces of The Project in a battle to rebuild the world after mankind has almost been destroyed by nuclear missiles. The game offers campaign, multi-player, and single-player skirmish modes. An extensive tech tree with over 400 different technologies, combined with the unit design system, allows for a wide variety of possible units and tactics. The AUR package installs its videos (FS#55310).

- Widelands — Slow-paced strategy like "the Settlers 2".

- Zero-K — Open source RTS game running on the Spring engine .

- Wrymsun — Fantasy game initially based on Stratagus engine.

sections.title: Turn-based
sections.content:
- Ancient Beast — Turn Based Strategy Game. Master your beasts!

- C-evo — A civilization style game, of the Civ II era.

- fheroes2 — Attempt to reimplement the Heroes of Might and Magic II engine using SDL.

- Four in a Row — Build a line of four of your marbles while trying to stop your opponent from doing the same. Also known as Connect Four. Part of gnome-extra.

- Freeciv — Multiuser clone of the famous Microprose game of Civilization.

- FreeCol — Turn-based strategy game based on Colonization.

- FreeOrion — Turn-based space empire and galactic conquest computer game. Inspired by the tradition of the Master of Orion games, but does not try to be a clone or remake of that series or any other game.

- GNOME Reversi — Dominate the board in a classic version of Reversi. Part of gnome-extra.

- GNOME Robots — The classic Chase game where you have to avoid a hoard of robots who are trying to kill you. Part of gnome-extra.

- KReversi — A Reversi implementation. Part of kde-games.

- KsirK — A risk-styled game in which players try to conquer the world by deciding which area to be invaded next. Part of kde-games.

- OpenXCom — An open source implementation of the game UFO: Enemy Unknown (X-Com: UFO defence in North America), with a plethora of community created mods.

- An extended and more customisable version of Open X-COM (OXCE) [4] – openxcom-extendedAUR
- Mods for Open X-COM and OXCE openxcom-mod-40kAUR, openxcom-mod-area51AUR, openxcom-mod-twotsAUR, openxcom-mod-xfilesAUR, openxcom-mod-xpiratezAUR

- Pioneers — A clone of the famous Settlers of Catan game with on-line functionality.

- Signus — Signus: The Artefact Wars classic turn-based strategy war game similar to the old Battle Isle series.

- TripleA — An online multiplayer turn based strategy game and board game engine.

- The Battle for Wesnoth — Free, turn-based tactical strategy game with a high fantasy theme, featuring both single-player, and online/hotseat multiplayer combat.

- VCMI — Attempt to reimplement Heroes of Might and Magic III.

sections.title: Tycoon/management games
sections.content:
- Cytopia — A city building simulation game.

- Lincity-ng — City simulation game in which you are required to build and maintain a city. You can win the game either by building a sustainable economy or by evacuating all citizens with spaceships.

- Konquest — A turn-based game in which the player wage wars by managing a fleet of spaceships and conquering other planets. Part of kde-games.

- Simutrans — Another Transport simulation that works on linux with sdl.

- OpenLoco — An open source re-implementation of Chris Sawyer's Locomotion.

- OpenTTD — Open source clone of the Microprose game "Transport Tycoon Deluxe", a popular game originally written by Chris Sawyer. It attempts to mimic the original game as closely as possible while extending it with new features.

- OpenRCT2 — Free reimplementation of the game "RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 (RCT2)" with multiplayer support. It requires a copy of the original game to play it.

sections.title: Visual novels
sections.content:
- Katawa Shoujo — Bishoujo-style visual novel game that tells a story of a young man and five other girls suffering with varying disabilities. The game is licensed under the Creative Commons CC-BY-NC-ND.

- Narcissu — Visual novel, telling the story of a terminally ill young man and woman.

- School Days — The story, a dramatic slice-of-life, follows Makoto Ito, a high school student who becomes the ambivalent love interest of several girls during his second term, and the effects this has on himself and his relationships with other characters.

- Summer Days — Spin-off from the "Days" series and remake of Summer Days.
